SENT.plain: The authors describe the case-history of a boy with secondary myelodysplastic syndrome (MDS) which developed into acute leukaemia
The latter was quite resistant to treatment
The disease was preceded by treatment of NH lymphoma with a high grade of malignity by radiotherapy and chemotherapy
The authors give the total doses of all cytostatics which were administered to the patient
One year prior to diagnosis of MDS cytogenetic examination of peripheral blood revealed a highly pathological karyotype, from the numerical and structural aspect
Among others monosomy of chromosome no. 5 was found which is typical for MDS and these changes indicate as a rule a poor prognosis and relatively early transformation to acute leukaemia
